intro: Verbesina lopez-mirandae, commonly known as the Lopez-Miranda beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
